result.execSummary:
The defendant AUSTIN E MANTHEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 75 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: -CASH BOND APPLIED. Court costs totaling $518.00 - Paid in full.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: -Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. AUSTIN E MANTHEY

records.addlTxt: **PROCESSING COMPLETE**

3:29 PM Defendant AUSTIN E MANTHEY in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for AUSTIN E MANTHEY.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF34, 2022TR156, and 2022TR157. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2022CF34 with probation and conditions and the TR citations will be dismissed. ADA concurs and makes statement. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged and orders 2022TR156 & 2022TR157 be dismissed. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-2 months county jail. Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

No expungement a this time. 

Court grants the defendant 75 days of sentence credit if revoked. 

Court adjourned at 3:40 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant AUSTIN E MANTHEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for AUSTIN E MANTHEY.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there is a motion to modify bond filed. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. Statement by ADA McElroy - objects to bond modification. Court denies motion to modify to bond. 

Court adjourned at 11:22 AM.
Motion hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:14 AM Defendant AUSTIN E MANTHEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for AUSTIN E MANTHEY. Statement by Atty Kapelis, will be a waiver of prelim. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on the felony on behalf of the defendant. Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on the traffic citations. Court will set for Return Date July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:18 AM.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on April 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Atty Michael Kapelis
Second appearance on April 5, 2022 at 11:15 am. / Instructions on How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Marquette Co Jail - confirmed)

9:40 AM Defendant AUSTIN E MANTHEY appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.   Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel for April 5, 2022 at 11:15 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:42 AM.
